intro: Orbea longidens, commonly known as the long-leaf orbea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a contrasting red or orange throat. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Orbea longidens is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
